intro: Dortmanna tenuior, commonly known as the slender marsh grass, is a small, herbaceous plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It typically grows in wet or marshy environments, often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with three stamens and a single pistil. Dortmanna tenuior plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetlands and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
